meanings.definition: Working part-time or intermittently in retirement.
meanings.sent1: My grandpa is semiretired, so he only works a few days a week.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys her semiretired life, balancing work with relaxation.
meanings.sent3: The semiretired dog only chases squirrels on Tuesdays.
meanings.sent4: The garden looked semiretired, with only a few flowers blooming sporadically.
meanings.sent5: The semiretired musician played at the local cafe every other weekend.

meanings.definition: To reduce one's working hours or responsibilities in retirement.
meanings.sent1: After decades of hard work, he decided to semiretired and spend more time with his family.
meanings.sent2: They semiretired early to enjoy life while they were still young.
meanings.sent3: The cat semiretired from catching mice and took up bird watching instead.
meanings.sent4: Her old car semiretired to the garage, only used for short trips now.
meanings.sent5: The chef semiretired from the restaurant but still cooked for special occasions.
